command: $ErrorActionPreference='Stop'; $pscp='pscp.exe'; $log="$env:ProgramData\NetAdmin\logs\T1597.log"; $host='sftp.whoisxmlapi.com'; $user=$env:WX_USER; $key=$env:WX_PPK; $hostkey=$env:WX_HOSTKEY; $remote='/bulk/reverse-whois/2025/09/30/reverse-whois-2025-09-30.csv'; $dest='C:\Intel\WhoisXML\reverse-whois-2025-09-30.csv'; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $dest) -Force | Out-Null; try { & $pscp -scp -batch -q -C -P 22 -i $key -hostkey $hostkey "$user@$host:$remote" "$dest"; if($LASTEXITCODE -ne 0){ throw "pscp exit code $LASTEXITCODE" }; $hash=(Get-FileHash -Algorithm SHA256 -Path $dest).Hash; $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; sha256=$hash; success=$true; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } catch { $status=[pscustomobject]@{ technique='T1597'; source=$host; remote_path=$remote; local_path=$dest; success=$false; error=$_.Exception.Message; ts=(Get-Date).ToString('o') } } finally { $json=$status|ConvertTo-Json -Compress; New-Item -ItemType Directory -Path (Split-Path $log) -Force | Out-Null; Add-Content -Path $log -Value $json; Write-Output $json }
explanation: Downloads a paid bulk reverse WHOIS dataset from WhoisXML API via SCP with key authentication; verifies integrity and emits JSON output for records.
rationale_steps: Use authenticated, closed-source bulk data access for targeted enterprise research.
Execute quiet, non-interactive transfer to reduce noise in system logs.
Validate integrity and produce JSON metadata for downstream processing.
Avoids public OSINT and focuses on subscription-only content.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed with proper variable declarations, error handling with try/catch/finally blocks, balanced quotes/braces, and correct command separators.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command fully implements T1597 (Search Closed Sources) by downloading paid WHOIS data from a private API using secure authentication, logging the activity, and verifying file integrity - all realistic operational steps for this technique.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: The PowerShell command is perfectly well-formed, using correct syntax for variable assignments, external command execution, control flow, object manipulation, and path operations.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: The command perfectly aligns with T1597 by programmatically downloading a bulk paid reverse WHOIS dataset from a specific external API, which directly constitutes acquiring intelligence from a closed source for targeting.

llm_judgments.syntactic_justification: PowerShell is well-formed with balanced quoting, valid try/catch/finally blocks, proper separators, and plausible pscp flags and argument formatting.
llm_judgments.semantic_justification: It operationally aligns with T1597 by pulling a paid dataset from WhoisXML via authenticated SSH copy and logging JSON, though it forces SCP (many such services are SFTP-only), computes but does not validate the hash, and may hit permission issues writing to C:\Intel/ProgramData without elevated rights.
